etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Chemical Abstracts. From German Pelargonidin from Pelargon- (in scientific Latin Pelargonium) + German -idin

definitions: An anthocyanidin (usually isolated as the chloride, C₁₅ H₁₁ O₅ Cl) of which pelargonin and many other red plant pigments are glycosides.
